revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-29 23:51:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional regression test for bug 1853009

Bug 1853009 describes a race condition involving multiple nova-compute
services with ironic. As the compute services start up, the hash ring
rebalances, and the compute services have an inconsistent view of which
is responsible for a compute node.

The sequence of actions here is adapted from a real world log [1], where
multiple nova-compute services were started simultaneously. In some
cases mocks are used to simulate race conditions.

There are three main issues with the behaviour:

* host2 deletes the orphan node compute node after host1 has taken
  ownership of it.

* host1 assumes that another compute service will not delete its nodes.
  Once a node is in rt.compute_nodes, it is not removed again unless the
  node is orphaned. This prevents host1 from recreating the compute
  node.

* host1 assumes that another compute service will not delete its
  resource providers. Once an RP is in the provider tree, it is not
  removed.

This functional test documents the current behaviour, with the idea that
it can be updated as this behaviour is fixed.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/786272/

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ice4071722de54e8d20bb8c3795be22f1995940cd
Related-Bug: #1853009
Related-Bug: #1853159
(cherry picked from commit 59d9871e8a0672538f8ffc43ae99b3d1c4b08909)
'}]
commit_message:
Add functional regression test for bug 1853009

Bug 1853009 describes a race condition involving multiple nova-compute
services with ironic. As the compute services start up, the hash ring
rebalances, and the compute services have an inconsistent view of which
is responsible for a compute node.

The sequence of actions here is adapted from a real world log [1], where
multiple nova-compute services were started simultaneously. In some
cases mocks are used to simulate race conditions.

There are three main issues with the behaviour:

* host2 deletes the orphan node compute node after host1 has taken
  ownership of it.

* host1 assumes that another compute service will not delete its nodes.
  Once a node is in rt.compute_nodes, it is not removed again unless the
  node is orphaned. This prevents host1 from recreating the compute
  node.

* host1 assumes that another compute service will not delete its
  resource providers. Once an RP is in the provider tree, it is not
  removed.

This functional test documents the current behaviour, with the idea that
it can be updated as this behaviour is fixed.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/786272/

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ice4071722de54e8d20bb8c3795be22f1995940cd
Related-Bug: #1853009
Related-Bug: #1853159
(cherry picked from commit 59d9871e8a0672538f8ffc43ae99b3d1c4b08909)

'}]
commit_message:
Add service ordering to cleanup service to avoid conflicts with agent startup

If the port cleanup takes too long, the neutron agents might begin
operations on the ovs bridges while cleanup is still ongoing. This can
cause undefined behavior and errors in the agent.

Change-Id: Ia0e31c9469033c50a8b65af7fee1adf03b22d4c2
Closes-Bug: #1913623
(cherry picked from commit 0c20e1e1ac320e30aaedba980270dffbf4528fc3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-23 00:17:34.000000000', 'message': 'set manila context-is-admin policy rule for secure-rbac

In Triple-O, secure rbac overrides ensure that all service API
and resource RBAC policies do not enforce scope checks;
manila's "context_is_admin" rule is used by manila as a short
hand for checking the admin role in most "system" level operations.

Since tripleo deployments won't be enforcing scope yet, this
policy rule must be overridden to allow users with the admin role.

Change-Id: I912e4d0b1e3f604997c283bf466654c40fd7c57d
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
set manila context-is-admin policy rule for secure-rbac

In Triple-O, secure rbac overrides ensure that all service API
and resource RBAC policies do not enforce scope checks;
manila's "context_is_admin" rule is used by manila as a short
hand for checking the admin role in most "system" level operations.

Since tripleo deployments won't be enforcing scope yet, this
policy rule must be overridden to allow users with the admin role.

Change-Id: I912e4d0b1e3f604997c283bf466654c40fd7c57d
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

when setting the boot option.

Something I wanted to do for long time: let's make it a method on the node object:

 node.set_driver_internal_info('key', 'value')
 node.del_driver_internal_info('key')

It can probably be implemented more efficiently by marking driver_internal_info as modified.

For bonus point make node.driver_internal_info read-only."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2020-12-09 04:10:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2020-12-09 10:51:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

[{'created': '2020-12-01 01:12:08.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor driver_internal_info updates to a function

Making updates to driver_internal_info can result in hard to read code
due the requirement to assign the whole driver_internal_info back to
the node to trigger the expected update operation. This change
replaces all driver_internal_info update oprations with a new function
update_driver_internal_info.

The intent is for this change to have identical behaviour, but there
may be the odd case of a change now being correctly written because
driver_internal_info attribute is being properly set back.

Change-Id: Ib8917c3c674e77cd3aba6a1e73c65162e3ee1141

- set_driver_internal_info
- del_driver_internal_info
- timestamp_driver_internal_info

commit_message:
Refactor driver_internal_info updates to methods

Making updates to driver_internal_info can result in hard to read code
due the requirement to assign the whole driver_internal_info back to
the node to trigger the expected update operation. This change
replaces driver_internal_info update operations with a new
methods:
- set_driver_internal_info
- del_driver_internal_info
- timestamp_driver_internal_info

This change defines the functions and moves core conductor logic to
use them. Subsequent changes in this series will move drivers to use
the new functions.

Change-Id: Ib8917c3c674e77cd3aba6a1e73c65162e3ee1141

commit_message:
[stable/rocky] Regroup tests exclusion list and add new failing ones

Similarly to stein change I898c9a674963f850d9a6bd1fa29cb884288b8b70, this
regroups failing tests in a common list and updates it with recently
observed failures (as this is an EM branch)

Change-Id: I9ddc05a87ae79a32b56796ed9c1c9ab7deda9310

[{'account_id': 7386, 'date': '2021-09-30 20:44:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-09-30 21:45:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks, could we get some unit test coverage on the combinations of owner and project?'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-09-30 23:51:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Backport-Candidate+1

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> Thanks, could we get some unit test coverage on the combinations of owner and project?

I've been thinking the same, in theory the test_acl.yaml runs *should* be exercising this if memory serves, but allocations was also a weird case if memory serves. I guess my worry is this might break a system scoped (i.e. project = None) call to set a project ID. In this case I'd really like to see the the request as structured somehow or at least the case as in what was the project and what was attempting to be done.  Realistically we'll need to backport this to wallaby and xena. Marking backport-candidate so we don't forget."}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2021-10-01 00:16:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DellEMC_Ironic_CI'}, {'account_id': 7386, 'date': '2021-10-01 05:06:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the feedback! After looking at the tests, I'm not entirely sure what the right fix is. The test that is supposed to test restricted allocation creation is here:

https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/src/branch/master/ironic/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_allocation.py#L1130

However, after some testing it seems as if the test never actually reaches the part of the function that's supposed to check if a user has permission to create a restricted allocation:

https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/src/branch/master/ironic/api/controllers/v1/allocation.py#L304-L333

As far as I can tell, the reason is that if you look at the default for the rules:

https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/src/branch/master/ironic/common/policy.py#L1597-L1614

An ALLOCATION_CREATOR is actual a super-set of a SYSTEM_MEMBER:

https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/src/branch/master/ironic/common/policy.py#L135-L137

This means that a policy check on baremetal:allocation:create will always pass if it also passes on baremetal:allocation:create_restricted.

I created a quick unit test that forces baremetal:allocation:create to fail, and it does succeed in exposing the bug (and passes with the change in this PR). However I'm guessing the correct answer is to fix the allocation create policy defaults - but to what I'm not entirely sure."}, {'account_id': 7386, 'date': '2021-10-15 15:43:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7386, 'date': '2021-10-15 15:46:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Fix restricted allocation creation for old policy defaults

The logic for restricted allocation creation checks that the
user is not trying to create an allocation with an owner other
than themselves. However the logic as it stands will always fail,
as it does not check if the user actually set an allocation owner.

Change-Id: I780d8e88f9319dc37ab56309bddbfb6b5f3c9d13

commit_message:
Avoid RPC notify_conductor_resume_{deploy,clean} in agent_base

Currently we use an RPC call to the conductor itself to proceed to the
next clean or deploy step. This is unnecessary and requires temporary
lifting the lock, potentially causing race conditions.

This change makes the agent code use continue_node_{deploy,clean}
directly. The drivers still need updating, it will be done later.

Story: #2008167
Task: #40922
Change-Id: If4763d542029b9021432425532f24a0228f04c25

subject: inspector dnsmasq: make sequential-ip configurable

Add the parameter ``dnsmasq_dhcp_sequential_ip`` to the

commit_message:
inspector dnsmasq: make sequential-ip configurable

Add the parameter ``dnsmasq_dhcp_sequential_ip`` to the
ironic::inspector class. When true (the default) dnsmasq
is configured to serve addresses in sequential orders.

Some DHCPv6 clients don't operate well with a DHCP server
that serves addresses sequentially. The new parameter
allow disabling sequential addressing to improve
interoperability with DHCPv6 clients in UEFI firmware.

Closes-Bug: #1941908
Change-Id: Iad32434790a1744249b284937c6b67e9b58a235f
(cherry picked from commit 4f67b341eef9f0a84afefdbe63133c3449d2e1eb)

commit_message:
CI: Pin sushy-tools to fix CI

Pin the sushy-tools version so we don't try to pull in a later
version which happens to be incompatible with other libraries as
later sushy-tools versions expect basic auth methods from
ironic_lib.

Change-Id: I935d49219cde003790cebf8ab6c36136779fe7df

subject: Add the MTU size to ping to catch network issues
messages: [{'account_id': 7130, 'date': '2021-11-19 01:48:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 7130, 'date': '2021-11-19 13:32:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-12-07 16:14:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-19 01:48:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add the MTU size to ping to catch network issues

Many times users hit this issue where nic templates set jumbo
frames properly but switches are not properly configured and this
situation creates random issues hard to troubleshoot ranging from
a CEPH cluster not forming to swift not syncing properly.  Adding
an early test for MTU sizes in the ansible playbooks should fail
early and put us on a path to early solve this issue instead of
spending a week or more trying to figure out why CEPH batch LVM
is not working.

Change-Id: If4450e8cf1be8231f06033b603dba41dfa65ffbb
(cherry picked from commit 6acde891f85a06117dc39438bf78a8f9ef562a36)
'}]
commit_message:
Add the MTU size to ping to catch network issues

Many times users hit this issue where nic templates set jumbo
frames properly but switches are not properly configured and this
situation creates random issues hard to troubleshoot ranging from
a CEPH cluster not forming to swift not syncing properly.  Adding
an early test for MTU sizes in the ansible playbooks should fail
early and put us on a path to early solve this issue instead of
spending a week or more trying to figure out why CEPH batch LVM
is not working.

Change-Id: If4450e8cf1be8231f06033b603dba41dfa65ffbb
(cherry picked from commit 6acde891f85a06117dc39438bf78a8f9ef562a36)

commit_message:
opensuse: adjust for Python 3.x switch

opensuse switched for Train+ to Python 3.x, so installing python 2.x
packages like python-horizon is not going to work. this is anyway
an implicit dependency of the others so we don't need to list it.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/696580/

Change-Id: Idfdabe1372bc1ff2e34703697f3a37f4428e4637

Clarify that selected are Active goal as per new model

Community-wide goals are not coupled with cycle so
this commit adds a clarity on slected goals are Active goals
even they are targetted for more than one cycle.

commit_message:
Fix invalid dependencies

This fixes the invalid dependencies expecting the resource named
'placement-server', which doesn't exist.

In addition it's not necessary to restart service after creating
a keystone user and a keystone ednpoint so the dependency is loosen
following the current implementations in other modules.

Change-Id: I855490eccea8ab73b75d021be79f187279b788df

commit_message:
nova-compute: trim image a bit on CentOS

libguestfs package fetched kernel-core one which fetched linux-firmware.
We remove the last one and save ~500MB of space:

before/centos-binary-nova-compute: 3.3GB
after1/centos-binary-nova-compute: 2.71GB

Closes-Bug: #1946801
Change-Id: I98cc19c95fcec07dd4e494c14c09938d754f1de0
(cherry picked from commit bbef9846c3eff5c96d4e81ffd3b4cf3446dd1eb2)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If4b9bcfd1d4b2e7e22801403366d6e5882055397

commit_message:
Add Swift lock path in Swift containers

Swift-recon-cron requires rw access to the lock path
specified in in object-server.conf file. Currently it
doesn't exist in Swift containers

Closes-Bug: #1926203
Change-Id: Id3f824b741a5aa98efc7162fb7d49657e86a2bee
(cherry picked from commit ff25b500d23155485dc57d10aed9070a4cba88b4)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I05cae14856c839e4e466c66872f703bb72b2d0d1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-29 11:07:51.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Fix gateway_mtu option should not always be set

OVN Driver currently fixes gateway_mtu MTU to the provider MTU value
without considering if the private networks in the associated router
have greater MTU values than the provider. This is unnecesary and
adds extra actions for each packet. This patch fixes that, as now
gateway_mtu is only set in case the provider MTU is smaller than the
private MTU.

The changes in create_router_port and delete_router_port were necessary
as there could be a use case when the user first sets the gateway
router and later adds subnets from networks with greater MTU, so this
parameter needs to be checked after adding a subnet.

Closes-Bug: #1951559

Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If56f1a3dcdc8c57303d5641df79ea919ba7c170d
(cherry picked from commit 0725533a6fa6a42d361e518b027f69da8e1e1ec5)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix gateway_mtu option should not always be set

OVN Driver currently fixes gateway_mtu MTU to the provider MTU value
without considering if the private networks in the associated router
have greater MTU values than the provider. This is unnecesary and
adds extra actions for each packet. This patch fixes that, as now
gateway_mtu is only set in case the provider MTU is smaller than the
private MTU.

The changes in create_router_port and delete_router_port were necessary
as there could be a use case when the user first sets the gateway
router and later adds subnets from networks with greater MTU, so this
parameter needs to be checked after adding a subnet.

Closes-Bug: #1951559

Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If56f1a3dcdc8c57303d5641df79ea919ba7c170d
(cherry picked from commit 0725533a6fa6a42d361e518b027f69da8e1e1ec5)

commit_message:
Upgrade pip and friends in source images

New pip has nice features for detection of conflicting
requirements.

When installing from PyPI, as we do in source images, running
the latest pip+setuptools+wheel is recommended.

Co-authored-by: Marcin Juszkiewicz <marcin.juszkiewicz@linaro.org>
Change-Id: I4ae3a82cc796a60450c2a35beba32972964bc5d0

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix gateway_mtu option should not always be set

OVN Driver currently fixes gateway_mtu MTU to the provider MTU value
without considering if the private networks in the associated router
have greater MTU values than the provider. This is unnecesary and
adds extra actions for each packet. This patch fixes that, as now
gateway_mtu is only set in case the provider MTU is smaller than the
private MTU.

The changes in create_router_port and delete_router_port were necessary
as there could be a use case when the user first sets the gateway
router and later adds subnets from networks with greater MTU, so this
parameter needs to be checked after adding a subnet.

Closes-Bug: #1951559

Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If56f1a3dcdc8c57303d5641df79ea919ba7c170d
(cherry picked from commit 0725533a6fa6a42d361e518b027f69da8e1e1ec5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-29 11:07:14.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Fix gateway_mtu option should not always be set

OVN Driver currently fixes gateway_mtu MTU to the provider MTU value
without considering if the private networks in the associated router
have greater MTU values than the provider. This is unnecesary and
adds extra actions for each packet. This patch fixes that, as now
gateway_mtu is only set in case the provider MTU is smaller than the
private MTU.

The changes in create_router_port and delete_router_port were necessary
as there could be a use case when the user first sets the gateway
router and later adds subnets from networks with greater MTU, so this
parameter needs to be checked after adding a subnet.

Closes-Bug: #1951559

Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If56f1a3dcdc8c57303d5641df79ea919ba7c170d
(cherry picked from commit 0725533a6fa6a42d361e518b027f69da8e1e1ec5)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix gateway_mtu option should not always be set

OVN Driver currently fixes gateway_mtu MTU to the provider MTU value
without considering if the private networks in the associated router
have greater MTU values than the provider. This is unnecesary and
adds extra actions for each packet. This patch fixes that, as now
gateway_mtu is only set in case the provider MTU is smaller than the
private MTU.

The changes in create_router_port and delete_router_port were necessary
as there could be a use case when the user first sets the gateway
router and later adds subnets from networks with greater MTU, so this
parameter needs to be checked after adding a subnet.

Closes-Bug: #1951559

Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If56f1a3dcdc8c57303d5641df79ea919ba7c170d
(cherry picked from commit 0725533a6fa6a42d361e518b027f69da8e1e1ec5)

[{'created': '2021-12-03 09:59:34.000000000', 'message': 'Parametrize Gearman client listening port and host

The Log Gearman Client got hardcoded value for listening host
and it also uses default Gear port (4730) for listening.

commit_message:
Parametrize Gearman client listening port and host

The Log Gearman Client got hardcoded value for listening host
and it also uses default Gear port (4730) for listening.
It would be helpful for some deployments to parametrize those
options.

Change-Id: I01f41468f66008bf8ee7902e9f7dd4b31abbbf45

commit_message:
Fix policy for Orders

This patch adds checks to make sure that the project_id of the token
matches the project_id that owns the Order.

Currently, having a role on any project will allow the request to be
processed, which results in a 404 - Not Found instead of 401 -
Forbidden.

Change-Id: Ie0e6f6edae40e47d45afbe92fd509032cb091b1a

commit_message:
Use independent key file for designate

This is a follow-up of [1] and fixes the incorrect ssl key file used
for Designate. Currently Designate is configured to use the same file
as nova but we should use an independent key file for each service.

[1] c588332e5b307d4733b2c1b0f778ad703355f82f

Change-Id: I7d5810925e1db831b088ff35fd688a8b12c4f533

commit_message:
Do not test detail of keystone::resource::service_identity

... but test interfaces of that resource type. This helps us avoid
direct breakage caused by any change in puppet-keystone.

Change-Id: I137857f621bfa2fd29f19e621d665979b5cee3d0

subject: Update clouds.yaml to follow a profile authorization convention
messages:
[{'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-03-11 17:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-03-11 17:15:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: New patch set was added with same tree, parent, and commit message as Patch Set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-03-12 07:59:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'd not want to remove the existing cloud names. At least not without some long deprecation period. Even then, a short default cloud name like "devstack" is much nicer than having to use "devstack-demo-member" all the time. Maybe add them as aliases at least?'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-12-07 15:51:07.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Abandoning for now since I don't have the cycles to pick this back up. Please feel free to restore if anyone is interested in reviving this patch."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-11 17:00:20.000000000', 'message': "Update clouds.yaml to follow a profile authorization convention

It's handy to have the authorization for a profile baked into the name
so you can do things like this:

  $ openstack user list --os-cloud devstack-system-admin
  $ openstack server list --os-cloud devstack-demo-reader
  $ openstack volume create --os-cloud devstack-alt-member

Where the middle portion of the name is the authorization target (e.g.,
project name or system) and the last bit is the role (e.g., admin,
member, or reader).

With more OpenStack projects adopting secure RBAC personas, this makes
it easier to tinker with different situations locally if you use
clouds.yaml.

Change-Id: Ide5c475a434ade01b25b111e35bbfe0c702a1ce8
"}, {'created': '2021-03-11 17:15:06.000000000', 'message': "Update clouds.yaml to follow a profile authorization convention

It's handy to have the authorization for a profile baked into the name
so you can do things like this:

  $ openstack user list --os-cloud devstack-system-admin
  $ openstack server list --os-cloud devstack-demo-reader
  $ openstack volume create --os-cloud devstack-alt-member

Where the middle portion of the name is the authorization target (e.g.,
project name or system) and the last bit is the role (e.g., admin,
member, or reader).

With more OpenStack projects adopting secure RBAC personas, this makes
it easier to tinker with different situations locally if you use
clouds.yaml.

Change-Id: Ide5c475a434ade01b25b111e35bbfe0c702a1ce8
"}]
commit_message:
Update clouds.yaml to follow a profile authorization convention

It's handy to have the authorization for a profile baked into the name
so you can do things like this:

  $ openstack user list --os-cloud devstack-system-admin
  $ openstack server list --os-cloud devstack-demo-reader
  $ openstack volume create --os-cloud devstack-alt-member

Where the middle portion of the name is the authorization target (e.g.,
project name or system) and the last bit is the role (e.g., admin,
member, or reader).

With more OpenStack projects adopting secure RBAC personas, this makes
it easier to tinker with different situations locally if you use
clouds.yaml.

Change-Id: Ide5c475a434ade01b25b111e35bbfe0c702a1ce8

messages:
[{'account_id': 3031, 'date': '2020-05-26 05:12:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18058, 'date': '2020-05-26 17:48:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Thanks for this spec. Please fix a couple of typos if you're gonna push another patchset."}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-06-02 12:47:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2020-06-25 21:40:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

If this is what Nova has done, I support it.  Would like to see an answer to the performance question.  Also typos that need to be fixed.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-06-28 17:26:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Everyone is concerned about the performance issue.  At the Victoria Virtual PTG, someone suggested running rally with the no-op volume driver to get some performance results for computing this dynamically.

Additionally, there may still be race conditions with this approach.  But it does look promising as a way to accurate usage information.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-06-28 17:26:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 3031, 'date': '2020-06-29 01:08:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18058, 'date': '2020-06-30 14:53:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2020-07-01 14:27:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2020-07-01 14:29:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Thanks for adding the performance data.  Think this is getting close.'}, {'account_id': 28948, 'date': '2020-07-01 15:30:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-07-01 16:29:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The consensus from the mid-cycle and today's Cinder meeting is that there is support for this spec, so we'd like to give you some more time to address the comments.  So this spec has a spec-freeze exception until 1600 UTC on 10 July.  Ideally, you'll have your revisions completed before next week's Cinder meeting on 8 July so we can discuss any issues at the meeting and give you time in case you need to make a final revision."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-07-24 21:31:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

This spec missed the Victoria spec freeze.  The community is interested in the spec, however, so I encourage you to revise it and submit it to 'wallaby' (if you plan to work on it) or 'untargeted' (if you would like to see it implemented but don't plan to do it yourself)."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-10-15 15:07:15.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-2 by Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-12-07 15:31:06.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Superseded by https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder-specs/+/819693'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-01 11:21:11.000000000', 'message': "Refactor common configuration bits from service commands

The prepare_service call from ironic.common.service is changed to also
configure guru meditation and profiler. A new call prepare_command is
provided for the cases it's not required.

Change-Id: I5b9b7b7bc827c8bcda06e9a967deae8577ad87f4
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor common configuration bits from service commands

The prepare_service call from ironic.common.service is changed to also
configure guru meditation and profiler. A new call prepare_command is
provided for the cases it's not required.

Change-Id: I5b9b7b7bc827c8bcda06e9a967deae8577ad87f4

commit_message:
Reproduce bug 1953359

This patch adds a functional test that reproduces a race between
incoming migration and the update_available_resource periodic

Change-Id: I4be429c56aaa15ee12f448978c38214e741eae63
Related-Bug: #1953359

subject: Add additional details for the implementation
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-07 14:56:00.000000000', 'message': 'Add additional details for the implementation

Introduction of a new API microversion and explain the
interaction with older microversions through an additional
API layer.

Introduce a need for model versioning during the schema
update processes to allow a more seemles update.

Change-Id: I39dae9538589bd7ab0e51d1588f3c129e653c786
'}]
commit_message:
Add additional details for the implementation

Introduction of a new API microversion and explain the
interaction with older microversions through an additional
API layer.

Introduce a need for model versioning during the schema
update processes to allow a more seemles update.

Change-Id: I39dae9538589bd7ab0e51d1588f3c129e653c786

commit_message:
Update setup.cfg for updated testing runtime

TC has updated the Yoga testing runtime by making the python3.8 and
python3.9 as python version to tests:
- https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/yoga.html

Change-Id: I5495568854248dbeba85534ba250fd9b7a607b0c

commit_message:
fix 'huawei dorado v6' create new volume form snapshot error

    change the luncopy mode,in dorado v6 we use clone_pair
    modified some interface to call dorado v6

    DocImpact
    Closes-Bug: #1942342
    Implements:
    Change-Id:

Change-Id: I760cbd0467305f25fc29b5f9818749ae9007b40e

commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix init after do_setup call

This patch adds the do_setup method and adjusts the unit tests to
be ready for the upcoming changes regarding setup pattern on the
patch [1].

The refered patch implements the setup method on driver base
file. On solidfire.py there is no do_setup method implemented
so it gets stucked with a not implemented error on init.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/815659

Change-Id: I5e7a6de68810e33ed7f02d3dd49793912283f7d3

commit_message:
Drop syntax job on CentOS8 (and CentOS7)

Currently we run syntax job on Ubuntu only for usual modules while
we run also one on CentOS8 for libraries.
Since syntax job doesn't depend on the host OS, it's enough if we run
the job on Ubuntu.

Conflicts:
	zuul.d/layout.yaml
	zuul.d/linters.yaml

Resolved conflict caused by a different Puppet 6 minor version used
in Victoria. Also, resolved conflict caused by Puppet 5 syntax job
still enabled in Ussuri.

Change-Id: Ia086679798eaf4eb8eed83867125defe689909e3
(cherry picked from commit fc340a3da47a8c68b7573d86680b94dc04d69f0c)
(cherry picked from commit 0849daf900827d02e5cec52172b6d503c66bfa70)
(cherry picked from commit 1a6e1b764c6a3a222259159e3634c5ef4ef3cf69)
(cherry picked from commit 6eef4f4e75e5622fc4d8bcfdc68b37d2ec403b7d)

commit_message:
Victoria and before: Switch syntax/unit test job to CentOS8 Stream

This is a partial backport of a75e47446ad099fde90e2df300c663630d880677
and switches only syntax job and unit test job to CentOS8 Stream,
because these two jobs do not rely on host OS.
Integration job and litmus/beaker job on CentOS8 will be left now
but will be dropped once CentOS8 is EOLed.

Note that this change also includes the subsequent change[1] to fix
missing unit test job on CentOS8 for libraries.

[1] b54cb682d411569ccd881279d0aefe28b8464c6b

Conflicts:
	zuul.d/layout.yaml
	zuul.d/libraries.yaml
	zuul.d/linters.yaml
	zuul.d/unit.yaml

Change-Id: Ib7de126561d2e0a4d8cee2a596751467387eeb31
(cherry picked from commit 5ae2a889eae8c9fc3238748d69616ad64342d248)
(cherry picked from commit c5504e375ab059e841245ecf7db074cba36c60a2)

commit_message:
Add CentOS 8 Stream jobs to puppet-openstack

RDO has switched to use centos-8-stream to build and validate spec
changes in RDO Trunk for master. Also, now puppet-promotion pipeline is
using both CentOS Linux 8 and CentOS Stream 8 as promotion criteria.

This patch is adding CentOS 8 stream jobs in puppet-openstack projects.
First, i'm adding them to check pipelines as non-voting and once we
check they are stable we can move them to voting.

Conflicts:
	zuul.d/integration.yaml
	zuul.d/layout.yaml
	zuul.d/libraries.yaml
	zuul.d/unit.yaml

Change-Id: I6d5c26585a5f5687584a63435ce5cebba7ffae79
(cherry picked from commit acb80f48a2e7542d84423329f8deb04e8c223fcb)
(cherry picked from commit 7ed051e85c884fc426610f517c6591d8b371b658)
(cherry picked from commit 17d45da1650866627e470d3e3c4c6d21c43139a3)

commit_message:
Update default CRUSH algorithm to straw2

straw2 has been the default CRUSH algorithm since hammer
and Ubuntu Xenial ships with Jewel, meaning that straw2
is the default in all current LTS releases.

Change-Id: I97ce802072e35c61cad970ab5ce00849f5af1e97
Depends-On: I6fa4072eb33d763aca5721ee9fdd30b60d468a44
Closes-Bug: #1836092

Currently the os_package_type fact is used to distinguish Ubuntu and

Change-Id: I1686f318f928b404ff75bd2eca81a5037ef1e517

commit_message:
Avoid usage of custom os_package_type fact

Currently the os_package_type fact is used to distinguish Ubuntu and
Debian but it's redundant and built-in $::operatingsystem should be
enough. What is worse the custom fact is not injected while composing
facts data in unit tests and has never been tested properly.

Change-Id: I1686f318f928b404ff75bd2eca81a5037ef1e517

boot. This change adds the IronicDefaultBootMode parameter so the
default boot mode can be set appropriately for each environment.

Change-Id: I10348eb1aaf6a594ae06bcc855dfdd8c6c00bfe9
(cherry picked from commit 978f29d8c9fae06a82e1cbaf0f2c096cafa083f2)

commit_message:
Add parameter IronicDefaultBootMode

The change to hard-code the default boot mode to ``uefi`` was reverted
since the test environment (OVB on vexxhost) doesn't yet support UEFI
boot. This change adds the IronicDefaultBootMode parameter so the
default boot mode can be set appropriately for each environment.

Blueprint: whole-disk-default
Change-Id: I10348eb1aaf6a594ae06bcc855dfdd8c6c00bfe9
(cherry picked from commit 978f29d8c9fae06a82e1cbaf0f2c096cafa083f2)

commit_message:
New test case: "test_create_zone_on_provided_pool"

Prerequisite: Pool Scheduler is enabled in: /opt/stack/designate/setup.cfg
https://docs.openstack.org/designate/latest/admin/pool-scheduler.html

Test scenario:
1) Create a Pool using attributes: {'service_tier': 'GOLD'}
2) Create a Zone using attributes: {'service_tier': 'GOLD'}
3) Ensure that the created Zone was associated to the
   previously created pool.

Change-Id: Ia5698c268498c07a078dffe27d4a61e730f7f88a

commit_message:
Add missing mode setting on pxe created directories

Two calls to fileutils.ensure_tree were missing the follow-up chmod
for CONF.pxe.dir_permission. This is fixed with a local ensure_tree
function which creates the directory with the appropriate mode.

The configuration help for the permissions attributes clarify that the
system default umask is masked out on the supplied value.

Change-Id: I124d2ba09b0fc78b284c1ae871ca5a16fc44b8c9

commit_message:
Trivial: minor follow-up to redfish fix

Just fixing two incidents of received being incorrectly spelled
and adjusting the attribute error message slightly, in part
because it is an entire error, and not just a single missing
attribute.

commit_message:
Abort wait for 404 if the status changes to ERROR

This patch enhances the NotFound/404 waiter to not continue to wait
for a 404 if the zone goes into status ERROR.

Change-Id: I27d5d654b2b2b2b4cd8b8e85fdb1d7b1e4162516

'}]
commit_message:
[DNM] using druable queue in rabit

- This patch is trying to repoduce a ooo ci failure with devstack
to confirm if there is a bug in oslo_messaging when using durable queue
with nova-compute

https://573c8784298d839a8b87-0bc340e7b64291cec326146b77fc571d.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/820123/2/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario001-standalone/da34b71/logs/undercloud/var/log/containers/nova/nova-compute.log

Change-Id: I25e90da9f1d6b774bb70b2c69a3a4efb4c504282

commit_message:
Add a StaticScheduler without automatic scheduling

The automatic scheduling that was introduced in [0] is having some
issues. Add a StaticScheduler that can be used as an alternative for
deployments that want explicit control over where their BGP speakers are
getting scheduled.

Add a job that runs with the new scheduler.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-dynamic-routing/+/478455

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/+/815294
Closes-Bug: 1920065
Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: Ib7fcd0c7371bc75089b10024ee1b6e75c98f0188
(cherry picked from commit 8a0ddf6051c81b982187bb062b194284398f5703)

commit_message:
Add Designate hacking checks to the client

This patch adds the Designate hacking checks to also run against
the Designate client code to maintain consistent style
checking across the Designate repositories.

It also resolves one style check failure.

Change-Id: I09786482b2e7fecaa3d4484c9b1a017fae04cfea

to set network_config_update instead of the removed

commit_message:
node extract provisioned - use network_config_update

In change If53577a26edcb2dc67458603286471dfb87f0bda
network_deployment_actions was replaced with
network_config_update in the baremetal YAML definition.

Update the overcloud node extract provisioned command
to set network_config_update instead of the removed
network_deployment_actions parameter.

Related-Bug: #1951458
Change-Id: I3d52e17400d4c7b7a7ac8878eb289e8a84df5459

commit_message:
[OpenStackAnsible] Create Xena branch for OpenStack-Ansible Roles

This release patch is to ensure, that trailing typed projects have been
branched for Xena. The deadline for these deliverables is December 16.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this or update/-1
if something should be changed.

Change-Id: I8add6f8d384a537a724c750555fcd966aa217753

commit_message:
Don't test zaqar in CI

Unfortunately few projects like mistral/zaqar have little participation
and are kind of unmaintained atm, we should stop testing them in CI.
Recently zaqar is broken with latest pymongo (4.0).

Change-Id: I33d3aceacf03ad1baf29301885a8e88b17b7e476

commit_message:
Add "update_network" implementation to "L3AgentExtension" child classes

Added "update_network" method implementation to all "L3AgentExtension"
child classes. This new method will be added as a new abstract method
in future neutron-lib releases.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/818536
Related-Bug: #1950454
Change-Id: If319a47e65e4052dd3bbfba700819cbb9183a263

commit_message:
Update condition to include cloud-names.yaml

We are creating a new featureset064 that will deploy overcloud with
custom network + custom overcloud name + IPA integration.

For that new featureset, We don't want to add the default
file created from cloud-names.yaml.j2 template but instead use
the values we defined in ci tht templates[1] for custom networks.

Adding a var non_custom_network that defaults to true so that we
can override in fs064.

testproject: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/testproject/+/31954

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/812369

Change-Id: I4fec8997d3f74552b72a6e1a33258c684f683eff

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-02 06:45:34.000000000', 'message': 'reconstructor: remove non-durable files on handoffs

When a non-durable EC data fragment has been reverted from a handoff
node, it should removed if its mtime is older than the
commit_window. The test on the mtime was broken [1]: an incomplete
file path was given and the test always returned False i.e. the file
was never considered old enough to remove. As a result, non-durable
files would remain on handoff nodes until their reclaim age had
passed.

[1] Related-Change: I0d519ebaaade35249fb7b17bd5f419ffdaa616c0
Change-Id: I7f6458af3ed753ef8700a456d5a977b847f17ee8
Closes-Bug: 1951598
(cherry picked from commit e3069e6f7e0966ad55b05d3ab7838a4b61fb421c)
'}]
commit_message:
reconstructor: remove non-durable files on handoffs

When a non-durable EC data fragment has been reverted from a handoff
node, it should removed if its mtime is older than the
commit_window. The test on the mtime was broken [1]: an incomplete
file path was given and the test always returned False i.e. the file
was never considered old enough to remove. As a result, non-durable
files would remain on handoff nodes until their reclaim age had
passed.

[1] Related-Change: I0d519ebaaade35249fb7b17bd5f419ffdaa616c0
Change-Id: I7f6458af3ed753ef8700a456d5a977b847f17ee8
Closes-Bug: 1951598
(cherry picked from commit e3069e6f7e0966ad55b05d3ab7838a4b61fb421c)

commit_message:
[OVN] Chassis name (OVS system-id) must be a UUID formatted string

The OVS system-id must be a UUID formated string. If not, the OVN
metadata agent will log the error and exit.

Closes-Bug: #1952550
Change-Id: Iad2b07f6e40dcbf690889d3b69bc00bb2ed0c05c

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Resolves warnings like the following:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

Change-Id: I81c2a24fbf3341ad73a6f3057e3e47010f2663fa

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-26 12:31:59.000000000', 'message': "[OVS][FW] Initialize ConjIdMap._max_id depending on the current OFs

The OVS Firewall has a singleton class that manages the conjuction IDs
to used in the OF rules. Those conjuntions are used to group rules
related to remote security group IDs.

Now each time the OVS agent is started, the OVS Firewall initial
conjunction ID is calculated based on the present OF rules. This value
and the next one used won't clash with any present rule in the
integration bridge during the initial transient period.

Related-Bug: #1934917

Change-Id: Ie2e4441f766947a2164dec2d1555c7049428903f
(cherry picked from commit 0634dcc6d0f08c18c69a2c360a2c5c0581ec7bb6)
"}]
commit_message:
[OVS][FW] Initialize ConjIdMap._max_id depending on the current OFs

The OVS Firewall has a singleton class that manages the conjuction IDs
to used in the OF rules. Those conjuntions are used to group rules
related to remote security group IDs.

Now each time the OVS agent is started, the OVS Firewall initial
conjunction ID is calculated based on the present OF rules. This value
and the next one used won't clash with any present rule in the
integration bridge during the initial transient period.

Related-Bug: #1934917

Change-Id: Ie2e4441f766947a2164dec2d1555c7049428903f
(cherry picked from commit 0634dcc6d0f08c18c69a2c360a2c5c0581ec7bb6)

commit_message:
[OVS][FW] Initialize ConjIdMap._max_id depending on the current OFs

The OVS Firewall has a singleton class that manages the conjuction IDs
to used in the OF rules. Those conjuntions are used to group rules
related to remote security group IDs.

Now each time the OVS agent is started, the OVS Firewall initial
conjunction ID is calculated based on the present OF rules. This value
and the next one used won't clash with any present rule in the
integration bridge during the initial transient period.

Related-Bug: #1934917

Change-Id: Ie2e4441f766947a2164dec2d1555c7049428903f
(cherry picked from commit 0634dcc6d0f08c18c69a2c360a2c5c0581ec7bb6)

commit_message:
Move completed goals into the completed directory

As per the new structure of community-wide goal[1],
we will keep all the completed goals into separate
directory 'goals/completed/' which will help to
track the goals and a clear view on what all goals
still need more work.

Keeping 'Migrate from oslo.rootwrap to oslo.privsep'
goal in the selected directory only as this still need to
finish the work. Rest all previous cycle goals are moved
to 'goals/completed/' directory

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/#completing-goals

Change-Id: I6c0d979038f65abb091db646ddb4c0d09c43735a

DIB's tests suggest these images should build successfully again, so
let's see if we can get them to build and launch reachable nodes in
our providers.

Apparently Gentoo carries Python 3.9 now, so set that as well.

Change-Id: Id645cd6f15df6446ff81716c607ab4c8b17b7b22
"}]
commit_message:
Un-pause gentoo-17-0-systemd images

DIB's tests suggest these images should build successfully again, so
let's see if we can get them to build and launch reachable nodes in
our providers.

Apparently Gentoo carries Python 3.9 now, so set that as well.

Change-Id: Id645cd6f15df6446ff81716c607ab4c8b17b7b22

commit_message:
Select secure and consistent RBAC as a community-wide goal

RBAC goal has been reworked and has clear direction now.
As per the new structure of community-wide goals, goal
will not be associated with any cycle release but will have
different milestones. This goal has defined the different
milestones to complete the work.

Change-Id: I52744507cf5be6e47e96c69af4300cb84018c2e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-21 13:27:05.000000000', 'message': "Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: I94b3f8ba5116cdfb94e9d0dc575bd7edb1d27b3c

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: I94b3f8ba5116cdfb94e9d0dc575bd7edb1d27b3c

Change-Id: I94b3f8ba5116cdfb94e9d0dc575bd7edb1d27b3c

commit_message:
Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: I94b3f8ba5116cdfb94e9d0dc575bd7edb1d27b3c

commit_message:
Move API base out of admin test location

Originally ironic was entirely pruely just an admin API,
but this has changed, and we need to add additional non-admin
tests, so it makes sense to re-use to the base and share it
amongst the tests.

Change-Id: I0fe3e326e4a25dc0928080fd1111ca4c46d8134a

commit_message:
Ensure /etc/keystone/fernet-keys/ before bootstrap

The /etc/keystone/fernet-keys/ directory must exist prior to
keystone-manage bootstrap being called.

Closes-Bug: #1951076

commit_message:
Stop creating manifest .htaccess

This is no longer needed as this isn't dynamic so we can moved it to the
image-server httpd configuration. Additionally MultiviewsMatch is
causing problems so we don't want that anymore.  This file will be
ignored with the updated configuration so this just stops it from being
created going forward.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/820404
Change-Id: I307be36cfdd26510bbe5b48365d6c04881f61d1f
Related-Bug: #1953198

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-03 20:19:47.000000000', 'message': 'Disable image-serve MultiViews

The MultiViews configuration for manifests is causing the wrong
manifest data being returned for some tags.  This change removes the
MultiViews configuration and moves the configuration we used to put into
an .htaccess file into the image serve apache configuration.  The
manifest requests should no longer trigger the .htaccess configuration
but the .htaccess for the actual metadata file should still be returned
with this change.

Change-Id: Ifd86b50e308bca0b8fd4ddb870b289dde8dbe046
Closes-Bug: #1953198
'}, {'created': '2021-12-03 21:58:29.000000000', 'message': 'Disable image-serve MultiViews

The MultiViews configuration for manifests is causing the wrong
manifest data being returned for some tags.  This change removes the
MultiViews configuration and moves the configuration we used to put into
an .htaccess file into the image serve apache configuration.  The
manifest requests should no longer trigger the .htaccess configuration
but the .htaccess for the actual metadata file should still be returned

Change-Id: Ifd86b50e308bca0b8fd4ddb870b289dde8dbe046

commit_message:
Disable image-serve MultiViews

The MultiViews configuration for manifests is causing the wrong
manifest data being returned for some tags.  This change removes the
MultiViews configuration and moves the configuration we used to put into
an .htaccess file into the image serve apache configuration.  The
manifest requests should no longer trigger the .htaccess configuration
but the .htaccess for the actual metadata file should still be returned
with this change.

Change-Id: Ifd86b50e308bca0b8fd4ddb870b289dde8dbe046
Closes-Bug: #1953198

commit_message:
Add a configuration option to enable secure RBAC in Heat

This adds a new option called EnableSecureRbac so that you can
enable secure RBAC with keystone in TripleO deployments.

This option sets the necessary oslo.policy configuration options in
Heat's configuration file so support secure RBAC.

Change-Id: I865623feb4338c8f51b56d9916fe20f2c515a86e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Always upgrade ca-certificates

Ca-certificates is vital part of every system nowadays and it's
important to keep this package to it's latest state anytime role is ran.

Change-Id: Icde7acdc2ea0cbfa44d2f7f0ff8b35358d8cc9e8
(cherry picked from commit 8c4ef001c148dc16c980bfc7ea695311e6dfd612)

commit_message:
Add publish-to-pypi to Zuul project template

The long term goal here is to have a TripleO CI. For that, we need RDO
packaging, and for the latter, having releases on pypi would be a good
idea.

Change-Id: Ibf84808a5d057338601790faea44c26c2b42881f

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.7

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this version isn't longer officially supported.

Change-Id: Iea8035ed7c19d96e998f98f8040ea31af9175b28

commit_message:
Make test_cpu_dedicated use the same_host scheduler hint

Previously, test_cpu_dedicated relied on having a single host in the
deployment to force both its instances on the same compute host. To
that end, it used the max_compute_nodes config option. This patches
makes it use the same_host scheduler hint.

Change-Id: I8c597e7fbf40cef046cf401661697ec0b5fc1101

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 18:05:40.000000000', 'message': "Refactor NUMALive tests for legacy and current

Due to Nova feature [1] NUMALiveMigrationTest test methods
test_cpu_pinning and test_emulator_threads need to have an equivalent
set of tests that leverage cpu_dedicated_set instead of vcpu_pin_set.
Since the 'legacy' tests and the current implementations are virtually
identical the methods were moved to the new base class
NUMALiveMigrationBase and renamed base_cpu_pinning_test and
base_emulator_threads_test respectively. Two new child classes have now
been created NUMALiveMigrationLegacyTest and NUMALiveMigrationTest.
Both classes run their own test_cpu_pinning and test_emulator_threads
test methods but provide different nova.conf parameters when configuring
available host CPUs. In addition the new Legacy class has it's
microversion restricted to 2.25 to 2.73 and the current class uses 2.74
to latest.

All original helper methods from NUMALiveMigrationTest have been moved
to NUMALiveMigrationBase.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716344/
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716311/

Change-Id: Ia0c0ecb4116eecdc4985f7637a6b7c44dda6275f

"}, {'created': '2020-04-03 14:54:57.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Refactor NUMALive tests for legacy and current

Due to Nova feature [1] NUMALiveMigrationTest test methods
test_cpu_pinning and test_emulator_threads need to have an equivalent
set of tests that leverage cpu_dedicated_set instead of vcpu_pin_set.  A
new base class, NUMALiveMigrationBase, has now been created which will
contain the helper methods that were originally members of
NUMALiveMigrationTest.  NUMALiveMigrationTest will continue to exist as
a child of NUMALiveMigrationBase.  It's test methods are based on the
implementation of [1]. NUMALiveMigrationLegacyTest is the second child
of NUMALiveMigrationBase and will test the vcpu_pin_set parameter within
it's methods. One other key difference between the test procedures of
the two classes is that the legacy tests use DifferentHostFilter to aid
with the scheduling of guests while the NUMALiveMigrationTest methods
will use the host parameter introduced in 2.74 [2]. The 'legacy' tests
have had their microversion restricted to 2.25 throgh 2.73 and the
latest class is a range of 2.74 to 'latest'.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id67

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716344/
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716311/

Change-Id: Ia0c0ecb4116eecdc4985f7637a6b7c44dda6275f

commit_message:
WIP: Refactor NUMALive tests for legacy and current

Due to Nova feature [1] NUMALiveMigrationTest test methods
test_cpu_pinning and test_emulator_threads need to have an equivalent
set of tests that leverage cpu_dedicated_set instead of vcpu_pin_set.  A
new base class, NUMALiveMigrationBase, has now been created which will
contain the helper methods that were originally members of
NUMALiveMigrationTest.  NUMALiveMigrationTest will continue to exist as
a child of NUMALiveMigrationBase.  It's test methods are based on the
implementation of [1]. NUMALiveMigrationLegacyTest is the second child
of NUMALiveMigrationBase and will test the vcpu_pin_set parameter within
it's methods. One other key difference between the test procedures of
the two classes is that the legacy tests use DifferentHostFilter to aid
with the scheduling of guests while the NUMALiveMigrationTest methods
will use the host parameter introduced in 2.74 [2]. The 'legacy' tests
have had their microversion restricted to 2.25 throgh 2.73 and the
latest class is a range of 2.74 to 'latest'.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id67

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716344/
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716311/

Change-Id: Ia0c0ecb4116eecdc4985f7637a6b7c44dda6275f

we don't really have any gate testing for RHEL.  combine no testing with unexplained reasons, I see this as pretty high risk ... I don't want to be obstructive so if you're saying this OK we can go with it"}, {'account_id': 7130, 'date': '2020-06-29 13:23:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I hit this issue with a customer and this patch solved it for them.  In our downstream documentation, we also have that step before *any* other steps after subscribing hosts to RHN/Satellite so I think this would solve many issues as more and more customers are using diskimage-builder to customize their overcloud images or even create guest images based on RHEL.  It's not a requirement and I've hit this issue only once in the past ...   We can reproduce this internally still and I manually patch the code to avoid this issue myself."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-07-01 04:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-13 21:19:31.000000000', 'message': 'Disable all repositories after attaching a pool

Disable all repositories after attaching a pool as in some cases that
I still can't explain, the "-htb-" repositories are enabled by default
which causes problems later on when trying to install the packages.

Change-Id: I86b3baccd4b0932eb3686a17485f64ee09994dad
'}]
commit_message:
Disable all repositories after attaching a pool

Disable all repositories after attaching a pool as in some cases that
I still can't explain, the "-htb-" repositories are enabled by default
which causes problems later on when trying to install the packages.

Change-Id: I86b3baccd4b0932eb3686a17485f64ee09994dad

commit_message:
Drop separate cpupinning jobs

For all the tests that actually run upstream, we've completed the
conversion to pre-deployed CPU pinning configuration, and are no
longer changing cpu_(dedicated|shared)_set onthe fly. We can re-merge
all the jobs into a single main job. Let's also use this opportunity
to drop the -legacy job that tested with vcpu_pin)_set, as that's no
longer relevant upstream.

Change-Id: Ifac17163876b770a2ff3cc6c477256f1e8732553

commit_message:
Remove redfish cache entry upon errors

Some transient errors can ultimately cause the client to need to be
completely restarted due to cached connection data.

Ironic now explicitly removes the cache entry when a sushy
AccessError or python AttributeError is detected originating
from the library. This will now result in the prior cached connection
object to be discarded, and upon the next attempt to interact with
the same node, a new connection will be launched.

This will result in new sessions being created, but in all likelihood
the prior session had already timed out or had been administratively
removed. Sushy's code, as of
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/sushy/+/820076
will raise SessionService lookup access errors as AccessErrors.
Prior to that change, they should have been raised as AttributeError
as the previous call sould have returned None to be used as an object.

Change-Id: Icc6e5dd74d9f15e679a7e764fe49238ed6b8dc1e
Story: 2009719
Task: 44107

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-02 01:07:05.000000000', 'message': 'Drop hugepages live migration test and NUMAClient

It never runs upstream as we have no multi-NUMA VMs, and depends on
the NUMAClient to do introspection of the hosts. We want to stop doing
that, and be declarative in how we describe the environment to the
tests. The reason for outright dropping it instead of investing
immediately in a replacement is that this allows us to get rid of the
NUMAClient and its associated unit tests.

Change-Id: I86cd881da78a6d4b837e4a3bd144fd85592c0773

commit_message:
Drop hugepages live migration test and NUMAClient

It never runs upstream as we have no multi-NUMA VMs, and depends on
the NUMAClient to do introspection of the hosts. We want to stop doing
that, and be declarative in how we describe the environment to the
tests. The reason for outright dropping it instead of investing
immediately in a replacement is that this allows us to get rid of the
NUMAClient and its associated unit tests.

Change-Id: I86cd881da78a6d4b837e4a3bd144fd85592c0773

commit_message:
Database connection pooling improvements

- Implemented new variable ``connection_recycle_time`` responsible for SQLAlchemy's connection recycling
- Set new default values for db pooling variables which are inherited from the global ones.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/819424
Change-Id: If245cd3f12a919933d912205dd60f1e02f555f7c

commit_message:
Use config_template as a collection

Since we still use ceph-ansible that has their own implementation of
config_template module it's worth to use mentioned module as a collection
explicitly.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/820010
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/820192
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/820417

Change-Id: I4198e13defb5b2f7fb443364027ccf902bf19c90

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-04 18:56:57.000000000', 'message': 'Disable CentOS check

CentOS check fails with OOM. In order to merge required stuff
we temporary disable CentOS check until sort out the way how to reduce

commit_message:
Disable CentOS check

CentOS check fails with OOM. In order to merge required stuff
we temporary disable CentOS check until sort out the way how to reduce
RAM consumption by the check.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/820010
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/820192
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/820417
Change-Id: Ifd03510495483f90fce22328bea08b4e0fdafe49

commit_message:
Handle weak Etags

Refine the handling if resources provide weak Etags. In order to
be compatible with vendor implementations, sushy will provide
the original Etags in addition to Etags with stripped qualifiers.

Story: #2009680
Task: #43967

Change-Id: I47ce9fcd2fcd961c752545774ed4c95e496f7ea9

subject: Unpause fedora-34 and opensuse-15 image builds
messages: [{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-12-06 16:49:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-12-06 16:50:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-06 16:49:26.000000000', 'message': "Unpause fedora-34 and opensuse-15 image builds

Fedora-34 was paused until bug fixes could land in DIB and our nodepool
builder images could be updated. This happened about 2 weeks ago from
what I can tell so unpause and let those images build again.

Opensuse-15 was paused becuase the images failed to build. Unfortunately
that was almost a year ago and we don't have logs for why this was
broken. Unpause to generate new logs allowing us to debug them.

Change-Id: I7d1957304d90b9902f36eab8f45871e081373282
"}]
commit_message:
Unpause fedora-34 and opensuse-15 image builds

Fedora-34 was paused until bug fixes could land in DIB and our nodepool
builder images could be updated. This happened about 2 weeks ago from
what I can tell so unpause and let those images build again.

Opensuse-15 was paused becuase the images failed to build. Unfortunately
that was almost a year ago and we don't have logs for why this was
broken. Unpause to generate new logs allowing us to debug them.

Change-Id: I7d1957304d90b9902f36eab8f45871e081373282

'}, {'created': '2020-03-18 09:01:19.000000000', 'message': 'Add vrrp_garp_interval config option for HA VRRP

The keepalived will try to send 5 times garp (default
value of vrrp_garp_master_repeat) after transition to
MASTER. And there is a delay (vrrp_garp_interval) between
gratuitous ARP messages sent on an interface [1]. The
default value is zero that means if one get failed, try
next time immediately. In some extreme situations the
keepalived may get failed to send the garp packets out
due to the device or underlay dataplane is not ready.

This patch sets vrrp_garp_interval to 0.2 second for
neutron HA routers which gives the program time slot
to make things well configured.

[1] https://www.keepalived.org/manpage.html

commit_message:
Add vrrp_garp_interval config option for HA VRRP

The keepalived will try to send 5 times garp (default
value of vrrp_garp_master_repeat) after transition to
MASTER. And there is a delay (vrrp_garp_interval) between
gratuitous ARP messages sent on an interface [1]. The
default value is zero that means if one get failed, try
next time immediately. In some extreme situations the
keepalived may get failed to send the garp packets out
due to the device or underlay dataplane is not ready.

This patch sets vrrp_garp_interval to 0.2 second for
neutron HA routers which gives the program time slot
to make things well configured.

[1] https://www.keepalived.org/manpage.html

Related-bug: #1859832
Change-Id: I9c4f0f8bee43d695878aedfcd19c449540541991

commit_message:
Create a base class for cinder plugins

The purpose of this new class is to ease development for existing
and upcoming cinder plugins, for instance, the cookiecutter and
solidfire ones. This class makes development much more in line with
the existing reactive libraries.

Change-Id: I55a849dd11e83e5b2b23efcece6ff8dfa511c96f

commit_message:
Use openstack-charmers namespace when deploying

The charm will not deploy without specifying the
'openstack-charmers' namespace as the charm is not
promulgated at this time.

It would be good for this change to be backported.

Change-Id: I930e37d99f00b2b57cd644ca24d0f9b57bdfc66f
(cherry picked from commit f59a409c016d7a46cbc6488ed8237277b3248cbb)

commit_message:
nova-compute: trim image a bit on CentOS

libguestfs package fetched kernel-core one which fetched linux-firmware.
We remove the last one and save ~500MB of space:

before/centos-binary-nova-compute: 3.3GB
after1/centos-binary-nova-compute: 2.71GB

Closes-Bug: #1946801
Change-Id: I98cc19c95fcec07dd4e494c14c09938d754f1de0
(cherry picked from commit bbef9846c3eff5c96d4e81ffd3b4cf3446dd1eb2)

commit_message:
Callback port and address can now be set during init

Original http callback was set to obtain target from env vars.

This change allows for multiple http callbacks to coexist,
sending json to different server/port combinations while
also providing alternate way of setting server address and port.
Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I18a90f92ddbe13f7bafef23d6df4a83ecfe38a3e

Sending SIGTERM to a swift-*-server processes terminates the process

commit_message:
Swift: Stop *-server process gracefully

Sending SIGTERM to a swift-*-server processes terminates the process
immediately and can interrupt API requests. On the other hand SIGHUP
is used to terminate the process gracefully and the process stops
after it completeis all on-going requests.

This change ensures that SIGHUP is used to terminate *-server processes
so that stopping container doesn't interrupt API requests.

Closes-Bug: #1936762

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-22 21:36:43.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Rework the yoga secure RBAC community goal

The Yoga PTG shed a lot of discussion on the useage of system scope and
default roles.

The yoga community goal is still useful, but the discussions highlighted
some confusion in the current approach. We should update the goal to be
consistent with the discussions from the yoga PTG.

Change-Id: I061994e17bd96ace9e3d2040d342b71d3add99cc

commit_message:
Rework the yoga secure RBAC community goal

The Yoga PTG shed a lot of discussion on the useage of system scope and
default roles.

The yoga community goal is still useful, but the discussions highlighted
some confusion in the current approach. We should update the goal to be
consistent with the discussions from the yoga PTG.

This goal is divided into phases spanning the next few development
cycles.

Co-Authored-By: Ghanshyam Mann <gmann@ghanshyammann.com>

Change-Id: I061994e17bd96ace9e3d2040d342b71d3add99cc

subject: WIP: Add definitions for database pool sizes in global parameters
messages:
[{'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-04-16 07:51:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-04-16 07:52:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-04-16 07:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

As-per the related bug, I suspect this will either need a release note instructing larger deployments to increase these values, or we might want to have slightly larger defaults for core services like keystone/neutron/nova'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-04-16 07:58:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-04-16 08:10:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

An alternative approach for the defaults would be to set the max_pool_size to ~10, but have a larger default max_overflow. As those connections are not persistent there is less chance of them contributing to the database hitting max_connections.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-04-16 08:24:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> An alternative approach for the defaults would be to set the max_pool_size to ~10, but have a larger default max_overflow. As those connections are not persistent there is less chance of them contributing to the database hitting max_connections.

Well.. I think that max_pool_size for core services is pretty fair. But not sure why to exceed max_overflow? To allow the current amount of connections when required? As total connections will be max_pool_size+max_overflow



So I agree that having max_pool_size is probably more wise. We need to create a reno indeed anyway since we're changing defaults.

And regarding max_overflow - dunno... What I saw recently was galera become unrespinsible when user tried to create 150 instances at once. So for sure we should not increase it to the point where we were by default (120). What is wise number is a good question..."}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-04-16 08:28:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It looks like Keystone uses a default max_overflow of 50, so I was considering max_pool_size of 10 (intended to cover base load), and max_overflow of 50 (intended to cover peak load such as a 150 instance create). In some cases a deployment may still benefit from increasing galera max_connections too, but hopefully that's a fair compromise as a default."}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-04-16 08:33:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> It looks like Keystone uses a default max_overflow of 50, so I was considering max_pool_size of 10 (intended to cover base load), and max_overflow of 50 (intended to cover peak load such as a 150 instance create). In some cases a deployment may still benefit from increasing galera max_connections too, but hopefully that's a fair compromise as a default.

Sounds good"}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-04-16 12:52:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

After some trials and calculations these values still seem a little high. Added notes to https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/db_pool_calculations'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-04-16 16:52:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Will have some play with numbers on monday as well'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-12-06 16:09:06.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
WIP: Add definitions for database pool sizes in global parameters

Values are matched to the SQLAlchemy defaults and should work
well with the way 'galera_max_connections' is defined. Larger
deployments need to adjust that value significantly when increasing
these.

Change-Id: I7410576bd0d28be12b8838c6e2a853b7b8dc950c
Related-Bug: #1478071

commit_message:
Reduce manila CI check memory consumption

New manila images require more then 300Mb of RAM. Otherwise
instance fail to boot with kernel panic.

Based on that we increase flavor for manila and trying to save
RAM in other places. While this works nicely for Ubuntu, CentOS
is still unhappy and needs more work.
But to unblock manila role, CentOS issue will be solved with
follow-up patch only.

Change-Id: I3a3bb59bb6ab8c5cb161e78accbbb45482e595a0

commit_message:
iweb: disable image uploads

We are having issues talking to https://image.api.mtl01.cloud.iweb.com
as it appears to be missing an intermediate certificate.

This has been reported to the provider (Ticket #4526047)

In the mean time, disable uploads, which are in a failure loop.

Change-Id: If224a44eb3a0727cdb34c7f016c6407bac610549

commit_message:
Add collectd plugins and related packages

back to the collectd container.

collectd-iptables does not build anymore on CentOS 9, because
of a change in iptables.
collectd-generic-jmx requires collectd-java, which was not included
in the previous set of packages anyways.

Change-Id: I92976c6c8b0cb348fbd057ff1c390a8e6e6e8993

commit_message:
Add CURD actions for packet rate limit rule

Neutron added new QoS rule [1] for packet rate limit.
Neutron fullstack test cases [2] rely on the neutron client
to interact with the neutron-server (API), so for new QoS rule
`packet rate limit`, we add the needed methods for new
cases of the QoS driver testing.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html#qos-packet-rate-limit-rules
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/tests/fullstack/resources/process.py#L24

Change-Id: I0ad236c9e585a25fbd405813ac48898a2df897d2

commit_message:
rbd: add support flatten volume from image

This will allow to flatten volume created from image (glance)
It can be useful in two scenarios:
1. Allow removing glance image
2. In case of losing Rados object or PG related to the image,
child volumes won't be affected

Signed-off-by: Seena Fallah <seenafallah@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I42d6ed587ca0e81267fbe94028d63f9decc96d18
